overview_of_class:
This class is a level 2 technique class, designed to deepen the potential for expression in the moving body, using weight, space, time and intention to begin to infuse personal and technical movement with urgency, vitality and humanity. Bartenieff fundamentals will be explored. Modern 2 will deepen the understanding of several modern technical concepts:

? contraction and release
? fall and recovery
? core/distal initiation
? backspace initiation of placement
? sequencing movement through the body and space
? radial energy
? head/tail connection
? internal/external focus
? transitional movement

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? Deepen the experience and ownership of the outlined technical concepts
? Increase awareness of local and global space through solo and communal work and focus
? Increase awareness of differentiation between guided and free improvisation
? Mutually support and inform focused technical exercises through improvisation
? Begin to center technical exploration as a search for sensation that informs form and movement, and emphasizes exploration
? Increase awareness of internal and external focus in class and performance
? Increase proficiency in floorwork skills
? Increase sense of weight, swing and use of gravity through release
? Increase stretch, strength and stamina

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Written statement of goals, class videos every two weeks from the quarter viewed, final written reflection on class videos and goals review, final group assignment
